hints.content: Start by understanding how to determine the number of digits in a number. You can convert the number to a string and check its length, or use mathematical operations like repeatedly dividing by 10.
Consider how you can iterate through the array of numbers. You will need to check each number individually to see if it has an even number of digits.
Think about how to check if a number has an even number of digits. You can use the modulus operator (%) to check if the length is even: `length % 2 == 0`.
Remember to initialize a counter to keep track of how many numbers have an even number of digits. You will increment this counter each time you find such a number.
As you iterate through the array, make sure to handle edge cases, such as single-digit numbers. Single-digit numbers will always have an odd number of digits.
Consider using a loop to go through each number in the array. For each number, convert it to a string to find its length, or use a mathematical approach to count the digits.
After counting the digits, check if the count is even. If it is, increment your counter. You can use a simple if statement for this check.
Once you finish iterating through the entire array, return the counter that tracks how many numbers had an even number of digits.
Make sure to test your solution with various cases, including the minimum and maximum constraints. For example, test with an array of length 1 and with the largest possible numbers.
Finally, ensure that your function returns the correct output format, which is just an integer representing the count of numbers with an even number of digits.

questionNotes: Return the count of numbers with an even number of digits.
